item.title: Wired transmission medium
item.description: Wired networks remain ubiquitous even in today’s world, owing to their performance in transmitting data compared to wireless transmission media.

item.title: Network organisation
item.description: A network can differ in terms of the roles each device plays in the network. Generally, devices in a network can take up any of two roles:

item.title: Residential gateway
item.description: A network device often used in home and small office networks that combines the [[technology/networking/network-router|router]], [[technology/networking/network-switch-and-bridge|switch]], and [[technology/networking/wireless-access-point|wireless access point]].

item.title: Network hub
item.description: A network device that connects multiple devices to the same network and transmits received packets to all connected devices, regardless of which device the packet is intended for.

item.title: Wireless access point
item.description: A network device that provides a connection between wireless devices up to 100 metres away. Can connect to wired networks and supply a wireless network.

item.title: Modem
item.description: A network device often used in long-range networks to extend the range of the transmission of data. The term is a portmanteau of modulator-demodulator.

item.title: Network router
item.description: A network device that receives and forwards data between separate networks using Internet protocols.

item.title: Network Interface Controller
item.description: A network device built or inserted into end-user devices that provides LAN connectivity to the device. Often comes in the form of a card that can be installed, an external USB adapter, or being built into the motherboard.

item.title: Area networks
item.description: When talking about networking, there are three kinds of area networks that are of importance. They include the: local area network; metropolitan area network; and wide area network.

item.title: Network switch and bridge
item.description: A network device that constructs a single network and provides connection points to all network-enabled devices to form a local area network.

item.title: Network
item.description: The connection of at least two computer systems either by a cable or wireless connection. In today’s context, the internet is the world’s largest network (literally spelling out inter network) that connects devices across the world.
